alert.note: Alert for Eastern Cherry; Western Cherry (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 31 at 12:15AM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Cherry County through 100 AM CDT... At 1215 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles northwest of Valentine National Wildlife Refuge, or 20 miles southwest of Valentine, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Brownlee, Valentine National Wildlife Refuge, Wood Lake, Schlagel Creek State Wildlife Management Area, Big Alkali Lake State Wildlife Management Area, Highway 83 crossing the North Loup River and Highway 83 crossing Goose Creek. This includes the following highways... Highway 20 between mile markers 207 and 223. Highway 97 between mile markers 122 and 124. Highway 83 between mile markers 170 and 204. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 AM CDT for north central Nebraska.
